title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutral feelings about Super Bowl LX initially, stating he wasn't rooting for the Patriots.
Brady later showed support for the Patriots on Instagram, encouraging owner Robert Kraft to win a seventh ring.
Teammates criticized Brady's initial stance, citing his connection to the Patriots despite owning a share in the Raiders.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Matthew Stafford won the 2025-26 NFL MVP award over Drake Maye by six points.
Jeff Saturday and Mina Kimes argued Drake Maye was more deserving due to his dual-threat capability.
Maye had a higher QBR against common opponents and lacked elite offensive weapons compared to Stafford.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need to pressure Seahawks' Sam Darnold, who struggled under blitz during regular season but excelled in playoffs.
Drake Maye's mobility could exploit Seattle's defense, which ranks low in yards per rush allowed to quarterbacks.
Patriots' top corner Christian Gonzalez may face Jaxon Smith-Njigba, who had 1,793 yards and 10 touchdowns this season.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Quarterback Drake Maye is expected to play in the Super Bowl with no injury designation.
Patriots captains Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are questionable for the Super Bowl with knee and ankle injuries.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is questionable, while the Patriots prepare for Sunday's game against the Seahawks.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' streams on Netflix; a modern Western about brothers robbing banks to save their Texas ranch.
'Splitsville,' a 2025 romantic comedy involving complicated relationships, is available on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics are streaming on Peacock, with Gold Zone offering continuous coverage of medal events.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' has inspired a rallying cry among New England Patriots fans.
The phrase emerged after Diggs's motivational speech during a key game against the Buffalo Bills, sparking the team's turnaround.
Despite facing personal legal challenges, Diggs remains a vocal leader for the Patriots as they prepare for Super Bowl LX.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris from North Attleboro will run her first Boston Marathon in 2026 to raise funds for Massachusetts General Hospital.
The funds raised by Demeris will support Emergency Response, Cancer Care & Research, and the Home Base Program.
Demeris's inspiration includes her best friend, a nurse, her mother, a cancer survivor, and her husband, an OEF veteran.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets announced the closure of its South End location in June after operating for 28 years.
Neighborhood opposition prevented The Croft School from replacing Foodie's, as residents sought to preserve retail use of the space.
The Croft School withdrew expansion plans at 1421 Washington St. citing community concerns; Foodie's continues operating its South Boston location.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The @DrakeMayeLover Instagram account has nearly 400,000 followers, started soon after Drake Maye was drafted by the Patriots.
Drake Maye acknowledged the account, which frequently posts memes and merchandise in support of the Patriots quarterback.
The account owner remains anonymous but expressed a willingness to reveal their identity if they meet Maye.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX, drawing mixed reactions from Patriots fans.
Nearly 700 fans shared their views, with opinions ranging from disappointment to understanding of Brady's new career roles.
Brady's comments were positioned as part of a new chapter, reflecting his broadcasting and Raiders ownership interests.
